definition: major event/major political event (war or change of regime)/major social event (wedding or funeral)/(do sth) in a big way/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
major turning point of lifelong import (esp. marriage)
to turn big problems into small ones, and small problems into no problems at all (idiom)
pinyin: da4 shi4 hua4 xiao3 , xiao3 shi4 hua4 liao3

sentences.english: Seeing their children get married will always be their top concern.
sentences.chinese: 兒女的婚姻大事，永遠都是他們最關心的事情。

sentences.english: The revision of Accounting Law is a great event in the accounting reform of our country.
sentences.chinese: 《會計法》的修訂是我國會計改革的一件大事。

sentences.english: We must concern ourselves with state affairs.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須關心國家大事。

sentences.english: The great arises out of small things that are honored and cared for.
sentences.chinese: 事無鉅細，任何大事都是由一系列的小事組成的。

sentences.english: "Our priority is the pets," Binder said.
sentences.chinese: “寵物是我們的頭等大事，”賓得說。

sentences.english: This is a huge, huge deal in Washington and it is a high-priority discussion.
sentences.chinese: 這是華盛頓的一件大事，必須優先考慮。

sentences.english: This sort of delayed coverage of significant events is standard practice.
sentences.chinese: 這種對重大事件延遲報道的方法是標準的做法。

sentences.english: "The big thing here is that there is nothing magic about cyberspace," Schneier says.
sentences.chinese: 這兒的大事是網絡空間沒有什麼魔法。

sentences.english: Thursday through Saturday, you're nearly blindsided by a huge issue at home.
sentences.chinese: 週四到週六，你會忽視家裏的一件大事。

sentences.english: Vendean Rebellion was a significant event during the French Revolution.
sentences.chinese: “旺代叛亂”是法國大革命中的一個重大事件。

sentences.english: George Macartney Diplomatic Corps' visit to China was one of the important events in the relationship between China and Britain in history.
sentences.chinese: 馬葛爾尼使團訪華是中英關係史上的一件大事。

sentences.english: Temperature and precipitation levels have influenced many major events in history.
sentences.chinese: 氣溫和降水量對歷史上的許多重大事件產生過影響。

sentences.english: "Yawning is a really big deal, " Provine said.
Moreover, it will help accumu-late funds for China's great cause.
sentences.chinese: 還會有助於爲中國的偉大事業積累資金。

sentences.english: The tribe marked important events with set ceremonialism.
sentences.chinese: 這個部落以固定的儀式紀念重大事件。

sentences.english: Tennine strokes announced a great event.
sentences.chinese: 十下接九下報告一件大事。

definition: one's employment/business/matter that needs to be settled/(northern dialect) (of a person) demanding/trying/troublesome/erhua variant of 事[shi4]/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1]
good action, deed, thing or work (also sarcastic, "a fine thing indeed")/charity/happy occasion/Daoist or Buddhist ceremony for the souls of the dead
to concern/on (some topic)/about/concerning/to have importance for
large scale program of lasting importance/project of paramount importance/to think big/annual national audit
to be occupied with sth/to have sth on one's mind/there is something the matter
